meanings.sent1: The old knife had a blunted edge.
meanings.sent2: The blunted pencil was difficult to use for drawing.
meanings.sent3: The blunted scissors struggled to cut through the thick paper.
meanings.sent4: His blunted sense of taste made everything seem bland.
meanings.sent5: The blunted blade of the axe made chopping wood a tedious task.

meanings.sent1: The blunted impact of the fall resulted in minor injuries.
meanings.sent2: The blunted emotions made it hard for her to express herself.
meanings.sent3: His blunted enthusiasm for the project was evident in his lackluster presentation.
meanings.sent4: The blunted response from the audience disappointed the performers.
meanings.sent5: The blunted colors of the painting failed to evoke any strong emotions.

meanings.sent1: The blunted intellect of the student hindered academic progress.
meanings.sent2: Her blunted memory made it challenging to recall important details.
meanings.sent3: The blunted wit of the comedian fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The blunted focus during the exam led to careless mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The blunted response to the urgent situation delayed necessary action.
